content:
SplitterEventHandler Delegate

Definition

Represents the method that will handle the SplitterMoving and SplitterMoved events of a Splitter.

In this Article

public delegate void SplitterEventHandler(object sender, SplitterEventArgs e);
Inheritance
Object
System.Delegate
SplitterEventHandler

Remarks

When you create a SplitterEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see Events.
